intro: Linanthus pusillus, commonly known as the small flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Linanthus pusillus is an important plant for pollinators and is also used in ecological restoration projects.
